definition: to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Spanish unemployment soared, and the budget went into deep deficit.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙失业率飞速上升，预算陷入深深的赤字之中。

sentences.english: Hunting without a license will land you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 无证狩猎将会使你陷入麻烦。

sentences.english: You make me wanna love, you make me wanna fall.
sentences.chinese: 你让我陷入爱河，时欢时喜。

sentences.english: Stylist was not immersed in general understanding to apply this to behave gimmick. However painterly combination effect.
sentences.chinese: 设计师没有陷入一般理解去运用这一表现手法。

sentences.english: And so we get mired in decision-making quicksand.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，我们陷入了决策困难的流沙。

sentences.english: S. could be thrown back into recession.
sentences.chinese: 而美国可以后仰陷入衰退。

sentences.english: Baby, I'm in so deep and you know I believed .
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，我陷入的太深，你知道我是很用情。

sentences.english: The last is the introduction of disturbation to avoid local optimization.
sentences.chinese: 第四，引入扰动以避免陷入局部优化。

sentences.english: In the 1990s, Harman Kardon was running into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 90年代，哈曼卡顿的经营陷入了困境。

sentences.english: Their advocacy about celebrity sometimes let youngsters become fans of so-called idols.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宣传有时会让年轻人陷入偶像崇拜之中。

sentences.english: His car got bogged down and wouldn't move.
sentences.chinese: 他的车子陷入泥沼开不动了。

sentences.english: We'll let ourselves in for trouble if we take over this business.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们接管这家企业，我们就会陷入麻烦。

sentences.english: Two high-income economies got themselves into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 两大高收入经济体使自己陷入了困境。

sentences.english: And in the eddy that does not let oneself be immersed in imitate to inscribe a mark.
sentences.chinese: 而不要让自己陷入模拟题分数的漩涡之中。

definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
caught in (a bad situation)/to fall into (trap etc)
to be in (some state, position, or condition)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
